feed.title: Coding Problem Solutions
feed.subtitle: List of my solutions to some coding problems on leetcode.com and binarysearch.com

entry.title: Valid Palindrome
entry.content:
My Solution:

JavaScript

/**
 * @param {string} s
 * @return {boolean}
 */
var isPalindrome = function (s) {
	let stripped = s.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9]/gi, "");

	let reversed = stripped.split("").reverse().join("");

	return stripped === reversed;
};

Python

def isPalindrome(self, s: str) -> bool:
    my_str = ''.join(c for c in s if c.isalnum()).lower()

    return my_str == my_str[::-1]

entry.title: Two Sum
entry.content:
My Solution:

def twoSum(nums: List[int], target: int) -> List[int]:
    for i in range(len(nums) - 1):
        for num in nums[i+1:]:
            if nums[i] + num == target:
                return [i, nums[i+1:].index(num) + i + 1]

entry.title: Roman to Integer
entry.content:
My Solution:

def romanToInt(self, s: str) -> int:
		basis = {
				"I": 1,
				"V": 5,
				"X": 10,
				"L": 50,
				"C": 100,
				"D": 500,
				"M": 1000,
		}

		nums = list(s)
		value = i = 0

		while i < len(nums):
				if i == len(nums) - 1 or basis[nums[i]] >= basis[nums[i+1]]:
						value += basis[nums[i]]
						i+=1
				else:
						value += (basis[nums[i+1]] - basis[nums[i]])
						i+=2

		return value

entry.title: Robinhood
entry.content:
My Solution:

from __future__ import division

def solve(n, e, o, t):
    year = 0
    target = n

    if n > t:
        return year

    while min(target, t) != t:
        if year % 2 == 0:
            target += target*e/100
        else:
            target += target*o/100

        year += 1

    return year

entry.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List
entry.content:
My Solution:

# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next

def deleteDuplicates(self, head: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:
		# empty or single item list
		if not head or not head.next:
				return head

		cur_node = head

		while cur_node.next:
				nxt_node = cur_node.next

				if cur_node.val == nxt_node.val:
						cur_node.next = nxt_node.next
				else:
						cur_node = cur_node.next
						nxt_node = nxt_node.next

		return head

entry.title: Plus One
entry.content:
My Solution:

JavaScript

/**
 * @param {number[]} digits
 * @return {number[]}
 */
var plusOne = function (digits) {
	for (let i = digits.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
		if (digits[i] + 1 >= 10) {
			digits[i] = digits[i] + 1 - 10;
			if (i == 0) {
				digits.unshift(1);
			}
		} else {
			digits[i] += 1;
			break;
		}
	}

	return digits;
};

entry.title: Palindrome Number
entry.content:
My Solution:

def isPalindrome(x: int) -> bool:
    num_str = str(x)
    if x < 0 or num_str != num_str[::-1]:
        return False
    else:
        return True

entry.title: Detect the Only Duplicate in a List
entry.content:
My Solution:

def solve(nums):
    nums_sorted = sorted(nums)

    for i in range(len(nums)):
        if i > len(nums) - 2:
            break

        a = nums_sorted[i]
        b = nums_sorted[i+1]

        if a == b:
            return a

entry.title: Merge Sorted Array
entry.content:
My Solution:

JavaScript

/**
 * @param {number[]} nums1
 * @param {number} m
 * @param {number[]} nums2
 * @param {number} n
 * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify nums1 in-place instead.
 */
var merge = function (nums1, m, nums2, n) {
	nums1.splice(m, nums1.length - m, ...nums2);
	nums1.sort((a, b) => a - b);
};

entry.title: Longest Common Prefix
entry.content:
My Solution:

def longestCommonPrefix(self, strs: List[str]) -> str:
		prefixes = []
		shorterStr = 0
		commonCount = 0
		shouldContinue = True
		i = 0

		if len(strs) < 2:
				return strs[0]

		while shouldContinue:
				if len(strs[i]) == 0 or len(strs[i+1]) == 0:
						return "";

				shorterStr = len(strs[i+1]) if len(strs[i]) > len(strs[i+1]) else len(strs[i])

				for j in range(0, shorterStr):
						if strs[i][j] == strs[i+1][j]:
								commonCount+=1
						else:
								break

				prefixes.append(commonCount)
				commonCount = 0
				i+=1

				if i == len(strs) - 1:
						shouldContinue = False;


		prefixes.sort()
		return strs[0][0:prefixes[0]]

My Solution:

def solve(n):
    num_list = []

    for i in range(1, n+1):
        if i % 3 == 0 or "3" in str(i) or "6" in str(i) or "9" in str(i):
            num_list.append("clap")
        else:
            num_list.append(str(i))

    return num_list
